pullRequest.body:
(MeasureTheory/Integral/Lebesgue): `setLintegral_pos_iff`
  For a given Measurable set `s`and a AEMeasurable function `f`, the subset of `s` where `f` is nonnegative is of nonnegative measure iff the lintegral of `f`on `s` is nonnegative.

Co-authored-by: Yury G. Kudryashov <ik333@cornell.edu>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: Can you update the PR description, please (since you removed one of the lemmas from this PR)? Thanks!

Done! Thanks for pointing it out

I think this looks good!
maintainer merge

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9461685918/job/26062966390)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9461685918/job/26062966108)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (h_nonneg : 0 < μ C) {h : α → ℝ≥0∞} (h_neq : ∀ x ∈ C, h x ≠ 0) (hm : Measurable h) ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [← restrict_measure_support] at h_nonneg ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (hf_fin : ∀ s, ∫⁻ x in s, f x ∂μ ≠ ∞) (hg_fin : ∀ s, ∫⁻ x in s, g x ∂μ ≠ ∞) ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion f =ᵐ[μ] g ↔ ∀ (s : Set α), ∀ᵐ x ∂ μ, x ∈ s → f x = g x := ```

```suggestion
    (fun h ↦ by filter_upwards [h univ] with x hx using by simpa using hx)
```
but to be honest, I am not really convinced by the lemma: do you have an example where having the lemma is more convenient than a `filter_upwards` application?

Thank you for pointing `filter_upwards` out. I ended up with a much simpler proof of this lemma (see [#8ba8c34](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13172/commits/8ba8c34266f4b4161383b0d0634638e95eebd16e)). Concerning the "motivation" of merging this lemma or not, I don't have rock solid arguments. I guess that, for people that are not familiar with the notion of filters (I did not even know the definition 6 months ago), it can be handy to have such measure theory basic lemmas, without digging to deep in the definition. If you believe it is irrelevant, then I don't mind removing it (or my entire PR), you're clearly the expert here 😄

We already have many versions of similar theorems in the file `MeasureTheory.Function.AEEqOfIntegralEq`, see for instance `AEMeasurable.ae_eq_of_forall_set_lintegral_eq`. How does your statement compare to these?
Thank you again! I needed this lemma for a bigger project and, for some reason, I did not found it in Mathlib. I ended reproving it, in a much more convoluted way... I removed it from my PR.
Please prove an `iff` version (probably, with `∃ᵐ x ∂μ, 0 < h x` in the RHS and an assumption `AEMeasurable h μ`) using `lintegral_eq_zero_iff'` and `pos_iff_ne_zero`.
Ok thanks for your comment and indications. See [#75116a4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/75116a4cc87132f8c146acc37eee1bde5aa87664).

How do you plan to use this lemma? It's true for any filter, not only `Measure.ae _`, so please prove it for `Filter.EventuallyEq` (or even `Filter.Eventually` with specializations to `EventuallyEq` and `EventuallyLE`).

Thanks again for this comment. I find your idea very relevant. I did a general proof for `Filter.Eventually` and specialization for `EventuallyEq` and `EventuallyLE`. However, Don't you think I should do another PR for these results?

I've just noticed that we already have `lintegral_pos_iff_support`. What about this for a set integral?
```lean
theorem setLintegral_pos_iff {f : α → ℝ≥0∞} (hf : Measurable f) {s : Set α} :
    0 < ∫⁻ a in s, f a ∂μ ↔ 0 < μ (Function.support f ∩ s) := by
  rw [lintegral_pos_iff_support hf, Measure.restrict_apply (measurableSet_support hf)]
```

You're right, that's a way better way to prove the same thing, thank you. I commited your changes and removed the `fun_ae_imp_set_ae` lemma.  I will open a new PR for the more general version on Filters.
Since this is entirely your work, maybe I should not be the only author of this PR. I can close this PR or make you a co-author, as you prefer. Anyway, thank you again for your help.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(MeasureTheory/Integral/Lebesgue): setLintegral_pos_iff
